item.title: BJP leader C.T. Ravi likely to be produced before Special Court in Bengaluru - The Hindu
item.description:
BJP Leader C.T. Ravi to Appear Before Special Court in Bengaluru

Date: December 20, 2024 Source: The Hindu

BJP MLC C.T. Ravi, arrested for making derogatory remarks about Minister Lakshmi Hebbalkar, is expected to appear in court today, following protests against his treatment by the police.

  • C.T. Ravi was arrested on December 19, 2024, after allegedly insulting Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar.
  • Following his arrest, there were protests by Ravi against the police actions.
  • Ravi accused the police of conspiracy and assault, while authorities refuted his claims.
  • He faces charges of sexual assault and outraging a woman's modesty.
  • There is public unrest surrounding his arrest, with BJP supporters gathering to support him.
“The police commissioner and other officers have taken the law in their own hands,” said BJP MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal.

The case surrounding C.T. Ravi's remarks has caused significant political tension and public demonstrations in Karnataka, indicating ongoing issues within local governance and law enforcement.

item.title: Decode Politics: From ‘alarm’ to ‘adoration’, how RSS, BJP evolved in their view of B R Ambedkar - The Indian Express
item.description:
Decode Politics: From ‘alarm’ to ‘adoration’, how RSS, BJP evolved in their view of B R Ambedkar

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: Indian Express

The ongoing political dynamics in India have spotlighted the BJP's shifting stance towards Dr. B R Ambedkar, especially amidst recent tensions in Parliament regarding remarks made by Union Home Minister Amit Shah.

  • The recent showdown in Parliament highlights the BJP's evolving stance on Ambedkar.
  • The BJP seeks to attract all Hindu castes, including Dalits, into its political fold.
  • The party’s engagement with Ambedkar is described as politically expedient, especially in competition with the weakened Congress.
  • Ambedkar's history as a critic of the caste system complicates his place within Hindu nationalist politics.
“The BJP has attempted to bring all Hindu castes, including Dalits, under the fold of Hindutva — constantly redefining its position on Ambedkar.”

This transformation in the BJP's approach to Ambedkar reflects broader changes in India's political landscape and the party’s strategy to unify diverse groups under its ideology.

item.title: How Delhi police caught rape accused from Gujarat after a 1,500-km chase - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Police Chase Rape Accused Across 1,500 km to Gujarat

Dec 20, 2024 08:11 AM IST - Hindustan Times

The Delhi Crime Branch arrested a 25-year-old man accused of rape from Surat in Gujarat after an extensive 1,500-km chase.

  1. The accused, Kuldeep, had been absconding since the registration of the case.
  2. He allegedly administered an intoxicating substance and committed sexual assault while capturing explicit photos and videos.
  3. These recordings were used to blackmail the victim, coercing her into further physical relations.
  4. Kuldeep, a resident of Bawana, Delhi, was eventually arrested in Surat, Gujarat.
  5. The police recovered a mobile phone containing explicit videos and photos used for blackmail and sextortion.
"The complainant, an employee in Bagwan Pura, had been befriended by the accused while working together. Under the pretext of trust, he administered an intoxicating substance and committed sexual assault while capturing explicit photos and videos. He used these recordings to blackmail the victim, coercing her into further physical relations." - Delhi Police

The arrest highlights the efficiency and persistence of the Delhi police in tracking down criminals.

item.title: Delhi's overall air quality remains ‘severe’, AQI over 450 in some areas - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi's Air Quality Remains ‘Severe’, AQI Over 450 in Some Areas

Date & Source: Dec 20, 2024 08:05 AM IST, Hindustan Times

Delhi's air quality on Thursday plunged into the 'severe plus' category, with a 24-hour average AQI of 451 recorded at 4 pm, according to CPCB data.

  • The overall AQI at around 8 am on Friday in Delhi stood at 434 - what the CPCB classifies as the severe category. Of the 35 monitoring stations listed on the government's Sameer app, Rohini, RK Puram, Sirifort, Dwarka Sector 8, Wazirpur were among those that recorded an AQI of over 450.
  • As per the CPCB, an AQI between 0 and 50 is considered 'good,' 51-100 'satisfactory,' 101-200 'moderate,' 201-300 'poor,' 301-400 'very poor,' 401-450 'severe,' and above 450 'severe plus.'
  • On Thursday, the city saw dangerously high levels of PM2.5, the primary pollutant, with 32 of the 35 monitoring stations recording air quality in the severe plus category. Some areas recorded AQI readings as high as 470. The PM2.5 particles, measuring 2.5 micrometers or less in diameter, pose significant health risks as they can penetrate deep into the lungs when inhaled.
Delhi remains under Stage IV of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP), which includes the most stringent anti-pollution measures. The measures involve a complete ban on construction activities and the entry of non-essential polluting trucks into the city.

The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) had issued a yellow alert for Friday, warning of very dense fog in some areas. The maximum temperature on Thursday was recorded at 23 degrees Celsius, slightly above the season's normal, while the minimum temperature was five degrees Celsius, three notches below normal, as per IMD.

item.title: FIR against Rahul Gandhi is diversionary tactic in response to his protest against Amit Shah: Congress - The Hindu
item.description:
Congress Claims FIR Against Rahul Gandhi is a Diversionary Tactic

Date: December 20, 2024 Source: ANI

The Congress party has alleged that the FIR against Rahul Gandhi is merely a distraction from his protests against Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks regarding B.R. Ambedkar.

  • Congress general secretary K.C. Venugopal stated the FIR serves as a diversionary tactic from Gandhi's protests.
  • Venugopal reiterated that defending Ambedkar's legacy is an honor for Gandhi.
  • Delhi Police has registered an FIR against Rahul Gandhi amidst political tension between Congress and BJP.
The FIR against Shri @RahulGandhi ji is nothing but a diversionary tactic in response to his staunch protest against the Home Minister. — K C Venugopal (@kcvenugopalmp)

The situation reflects ongoing conflict and accusations of political vendetta among parties.

item.title: Who Gave Permit For Trial Run? Cops Ask Navy In Mumbai Boat Tragedy - NDTV
item.description:
Mumbai Boat Tragedy: Cops Investigate Navy's Trial Run

Date: December 24, 2024   Source: NDTV

An Indian Navy boat lost control and crashed into a ferry, resulting in the deaths of 14 individuals and several injuries during a busy maritime route trial run.

  • The incident involved an Indian Navy boat conducting trials that crashed into a ferry.
  • The collision occurred on a busy route to Elephanta Island, raising questions about permission for the trial.
  • The police are investigating the protocols followed during the trial.
  • A Board of Inquiry has been instituted by the Navy to investigate the collision.
  • Life jackets have been made mandatory for all boat rides from the Gateway of India.
  • Search operations continue for a seven-year-old boy still missing from the incident.
The toll in the accident increased to 14, with ongoing search efforts for a missing child.

The tragic incident has prompted an investigation into safety protocols and maritime regulations to prevent future accidents.

item.title: 5 Dead, 35 Hurt In Huge Jaipur Fire As 2 Trucks Collide Outside Petrol Pump - NDTV
item.description:
5 Dead, 35 Hurt In Huge Jaipur Fire As 2 Trucks Collide Outside Petrol Pump

Date: December 20, 2024 | Source: NDTV

A catastrophic fire broke out in Jaipur due to a truck collision early this morning, resulting in at least five fatalities and 35 injuries.

  • The fire started around 5:30 AM on Ajmer Road after a CNG tanker caught fire.
  • Many vehicles were destroyed, with reports of several drivers suffering from severe burns.
  • The explosion from the fire was audible from as far as 10 kilometers away.
  • Chief Minister Bhajanlal Sharma has visited the hospital to oversee treatment for the injured.
  • Rescue operations are ongoing, with victims being transported to medical facilities.
"I pray to God to grant the departed souls a place in his supreme abode, give the bereaved families strength to bear this immense loss, and provide speedy recovery to the injured." — Bhajanlal Sharma

This tragic incident highlights the dangers of road transport and the need for stringent safety measures.

item.title: Congress says FIR against Rahul Gandhi for 'defending Ambedkar's legacy': ‘Badge of honour’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Congress Defends Rahul Gandhi Amid FIR Over Parliament Scuffle

Date: Dec 20, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Congress party has labeled the FIR against Rahul Gandhi, related to a scuffle in Parliament, as a diversionary tactic from the BJP following his protests against Amit Shah's comments on BR Ambedkar.

  • Congress claims the FIR is a reaction to Gandhi's firm stance on Ambedkar's legacy.
  • KC Venugopal described the FIR as a “badge of honour”.
  • Two BJP MPs were injured during the Parliament incident, leading to the complaint against Gandhi.
  • Congress is demanding action against BJP MPs for their conduct during the scuffle.
  • The controversy occurred during protests over Amit Shah's remarks.
“A case against him for defending Babasaheb’s legacy is a badge of honour.” - KC Venugopal

This situation underscores ongoing tensions between Congress and the BJP, particularly regarding how Parliament is being managed and the protection of civil rights within it.

item.title: ‘This is shameful’: SC criticises 3,000 tonne shortfall in treatment of Delhi’s solid waste - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Supreme Court Criticizes Delhi's 3,000 Tonne Solid Waste Treatment Shortfall

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Supreme Court has described as “shameful” the fact that nearly 3,000 tonnes of solid waste generated daily in Delhi remains untreated, highlighting serious issues with the government’s waste management compliance.

  • The Supreme Court criticized the Delhi government and the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) for failing to manage solid waste properly.
  • Approximately 11,000 tonnes of solid waste is generated daily in Delhi, with 3,000 tonnes remaining untreated.
  • The court summoned the Delhi chief secretary for clarification on compliance with the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016.
  • Concerns were raised regarding the lack of accurate data and inadequate responses regarding waste processing capacity.
  • Illegally dumped waste in sites like Ghazipur and Bhalswa poses serious environmental and health risks.
  • The court warned that failure to improve waste management may lead to halting developmental activities in the future.
“With some degree of sadness, we record that more than 3000 tonnes of solid waste remains untreated every day.”

The Supreme Court's criticism reflects deep concerns over pollution and public health in Delhi, urging immediate government action to resolve the solid waste crisis.

item.title: IAF chopper that crashed with Gen Rawat was due to human error of aircrew, House panel report - The Hindu
item.description:
Human Error Blamed for IAF Chopper Crash that Killed Gen Rawat, House Report Reveals

Published on: December 20, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The Mi-17 chopper crash that led to the death of Chief of Defence Staff Gen Bipin Rawat has been attributed to human error, according to a report by the Parliamentary standing committee on defence.

  • The crash occurred on December 8, 2021, during a flight from Sulur to Wellington.
  • Out of 34 helicopter crashes in the 2017-22 period, 19 were due to human error.
  • The IAF emphasizes that there was no mechanical failure or sabotage involved.
“The accident was a result of entry into clouds due to unexpected change in weather conditions...”

The report indicates that corrective measures have been enacted to reduce future risks.

item.title: ‘Human error’ behind Dec 8 chopper crash that killed Gen. Bipin Rawat: parliamentary panel report - The Hindu
item.description:
‘Human error’ behind Dec 8 chopper crash that killed Gen. Bipin Rawat: parliamentary panel report

Date & Source: December 20, 2024

The parliamentary report revealed that the tragic crash of Chief of Defence Staff Gen Bipin Rawat's helicopter on December 8, 2021, was due to human error. The report tabled in Parliament also highlighted the total number of Indian Air Force aircraft crashes during the 13th Defence Plan.

  • The Mi-17 V5 helicopter crash led to the death of Gen Rawat, his wife, and other armed forces personnel.
  • A total of 34 Indian Air Force crashes were reported during the mentioned period, including nine in 2021-22.
  • The report noted that human error (aircrew) was cited as the cause for the Mi-17 crash.
  • The defence ministry indicated that all necessary inquiries have been conducted along with remedial measures to prevent recurrence.
The ministry also informed that the recommendations by these Inquiry committees review the process, procedure, training, equipment, culture, operations, maintenance and administration holistically with intent to prevent recurrence of an accident.

This report emphasizes the need for stringent protocol and reviews in aviation safety within the armed forces to prevent such tragedies in the future.

item.title: Opposition's No-Confidence Motion Against Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar Dismissed - News18
item.description:
Opposition's No-Confidence Motion Against Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar Dismissed

Date: December 19, 2024 Source: News18

Rajya Sabha deputy chairman Harivansh dismissed a no-confidence motion against Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar, stating it was flawed and an attempt to damage his reputation.

  • The motion was submitted by at least 60 opposition members on December 10.
  • Harivansh described the impeachment notice as a “misadventure” aimed at trivializing the constitutional office of the Vice President.
  • Congress leader Jairam Ramesh criticized the ruling, saying it misrepresented facts from a recent press conference.
The ruling given by the Deputy Chairman of the Rajya Sabha today on the motion of no confidence in the Chairman submitted by INDIA parties contains a reference to some remarks made by me in a press conference held on Dec 12, 2024. This reference takes liberties with facts – to… pic.twitter.com/2DFWa5z1V6— Jairam Ramesh (@Jairam_Ramesh) December 19, 2024

Harivansh's ruling was aimed at preserving the dignity of Parliament amidst the ongoing political tensions.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session LIVE: Delhi police files FIR against Rahul Gandhi, removes 'attempt to murder' charge - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Police Files FIR Against Rahul Gandhi Amid Winter Session Turmoil

Date: Dec 20, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Winter Session of Parliament is nearing its end amid escalating tensions, particularly surrounding Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks about Dr. BR Ambedkar. This includes a recently filed FIR against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, where the serious charge of 'attempt to murder' has been removed.

  • High tension in Parliament with opposition MPs protesting Amit Shah's comments on BR Ambedkar.
  • Rahul Gandhi accused of pushing a BJP MP, Pratap Sarangi, during the protest, leading to injuries.
  • JPC on 'One Nation, One Election' bills may be formally initiated; committee members include leaders from major parties.
  • Nationwide protests planned by Congress against Amit Shah's remarks, calling for his resignation and apology.
“BJP MPs blocked our path and instigated the violence,” claimed Rahul Gandhi during a press briefing.

In conclusion, the political landscape in India remains turbulent with ongoing protests and significant allegations, casting a shadow over the Winter Session of Parliament.

item.title: CAT 2024 Result Out: Website to download scorecard - The Indian Express
item.description:
CAT 2024 Result Released: Download Your Scorecard Now

Date: December 12, 2024
Source: Indian Express

The Indian Institute of Management, Calcutta has announced the results for the CAT 2024 exam, which can now be checked on their official website.

  • Candidates should log in at iimcat.ac.in using their credentials to access their scorecards.
  • In total, 86 non-IIM institutions will use CAT 2024 scores for their management admissions.
  • The results will include the normalized percentile scores for candidates.
“Candidates are requested to download and save the results for further reference.”

In the previous year, Maharashtra saw a significant number of students achieving a 100 percentile score.

item.title: CAT Result 2024 Declared: 14 Students Score 100 Percentile, Check IIM CAT Scorecard Link - News18
item.description:
CAT Result 2024 Declared: 14 Students Score 100 Percentile

Date: December 20, 2024 Source: News18

The Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Calcutta has announced the results of the Common Admission Test (CAT) 2024. Fourteen candidates achieved a perfect score of 100 percentile.

  • Out of 3.29 lakh registered candidates, 2.93 lakh appeared for the examination.
  • 13 of the top scorers were engineers, and 13 candidates were male.
  • A total of 29 candidates scored 99.99 percentile, with 25 being engineers.
  • 67.53% of candidates were from the General category.
  • Candidates can access their scorecards on the IIM CAT website.
“CAT 2024 Score Card is live now. Candidates can download their scorecards by logging into the CAT 2024 website,” official source states.

With the release of these results, IIMs will now begin their admission processes based on the CAT scores, and 86 non-IIM institutions will also utilize these scores for admissions.

item.title: BJP MLC CT Ravi arrested for ‘offensive language’ against Karnataka minister Laxmi Hebbalkar - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BJP MLC CT Ravi Arrested for Offensive Remarks Against Karnataka Minister

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Karnataka BJP MLC C T Ravi was arrested following complaints of using derogatory language against minister Laxmi Hebbalkar during a legislative meeting.

  • C T Ravi was charged under sections related to sexual harassment and insulting the modesty of a woman.
  • The incident occurred on the last day of the Karnataka legislative council's winter session.
  • Ravi denied the allegations, labeling his arrest as politically motivated.
“Her allegations are false, let the audio and videos get verified.” - C T Ravi

The incident has sparked protests and raised discussions about decorum in legislative sessions.

item.title: IIM CAT Result 2024 released, 14 students score 100 percentile: Direct link - India Today
item.description:
IIM CAT Result 2024 Released: 14 Students Achieve 100 Percentile

Published On: Dec 19, 2024

Source: India Today

The much-anticipated IIM CAT Result 2024 has been declared by IIM Calcutta, revealing that 14 students have achieved perfect scores. Candidates can check their scores on the official website, iimcat.ac.in.

  • Out of 3.29 lakh registered candidates, 2.93 lakh appeared for the exam.
  • Among the 14 perfect scorers, 13 were engineers and 13 were males.
  • A total of 29 candidates scored 99.99 percentile; 25 of them were engineers.
  • The official website emphasizes its authenticity for CAT information.
“Please be aware that this is the only authentic website for CAT 2024.”

With results announced, candidates are advised to check for updates on cut-off scores and merit lists on the official website.

item.title: People revolting against Naidu, says Jagan.. - Greatandhra
item.description:
People revolting against Chandrababu Naidu, says Jagan

Publication Date: December 2023

Source: Great Andhra

YSR Congress party president Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy states that public discontent is rising against the Chandrababu Naidu-led government in Andhra Pradesh and calls for protests to channel this dissent.

  • Jagan claims that dissatisfaction with Naidu’s government has escalated significantly over the past six months.
  • Protests are planned focusing on specific issues, including rising electricity charges and pending student grants.
  • He highlights the negative impact of the TDP regime on farmers and essential agricultural initiatives.
  • Jagan emphasizes the need for collective action and resilience among party workers.
“These protests are not about politics; they are about standing by the people and amplifying their voices,” Jagan Mohan Reddy.

YSRCP aims to leverage public dissatisfaction to challenge TDP policies and strengthen its position for future elections.

item.title: U.S.-India relationship ‘very strong’ despite Pannun, Adani indictments: U.S. officials - The Hindu
item.description:
U.S.-India relationship ‘very strong’ despite Pannun, Adani indictments: U.S. officials

Date: December 19, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Senior U.S. officials affirm that recent legal challenges involving Indian citizens do not undermine the robust U.S.-India relationship.

  • Senior U.S. officials reject the idea that charges against Indian nationals impact bilateral ties.
  • Indictments include charges against Gurpatwant Singh Pannun related to an alleged assassination plot.
  • Businessman Gautam Adani faces securities and wire fraud accusations.
  • U.S.-India relationship characterized as strong, resilient, and mature despite challenges.
  • The future of this relationship remains uncertain with potential changes under the incoming Trump administration.
“The key is how we deal with those, and I can just assure you that we’ve had the deepest possible, appropriate consultation between the two sides.”

Overall, the U.S.-India relationship appears poised to endure challenges through effective communication and collaboration.
